title: Remove VR bottom navigation tab while keeping VR access via AIR module

requirements.summary: Remove the VR tab from the fixed bottom navigation so VR is no longer accessible from bottom-nav.
acceptanceCriteria: The bottom navigation no longer renders a tab labeled “VR”.
There is no visual gap or broken layout in the bottom navigation after removing the VR tab.
Users can still reach the VR Spaces Hub via the AIR/Gaming portal entry points (e.g., GamingPage navigation to VR Spaces Hub still works).

file_operations.description: Remove the 'VR' tab from the bottom navigation tabs list (including its icon import) and ensure the remaining tabs render with consistent spacing and alignment (no gaps).

requirements.summary: Remove the VR bottom-nav tab concept from types and MainLayout tab routing while keeping VR views reachable via in-module navigation flows.
acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript builds without references to a 'vr' bottom-nav tab.
MainLayout no longer includes a switch case for an activeTab value of 'vr'.
VR-related pages (e.g., VR Spaces Hub) remain accessible through existing in-module navigation callbacks.

file_operations.description: Update the Tab union type to remove 'vr', remove the activeTab switch case that renders VR from bottom-nav, and ensure any tab-change logic cannot set activeTab to 'vr' while preserving currentView-based navigation to VR pages (e.g., vrSpacesHub/vrSpaceCreation/gameVRDetail) via existing callbacks.

Update the Tab union type to remove 'vr' and remove the VR-specific create flow tied to the bottom-nav module concept (e.g., the 'vr' branch and any VR-create UI state), keeping VR creation accessible via existing VR hub/module navigation instead.

requirements.summary: Update the investor guided stepper sequence to skip the removed VR bottom-nav module.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the stepper cycles through the remaining modules without errors.

file_operations.description: Remove 'vr' from the Tab union type, flowSequence, and tabLabels so the stepper only advances through the remaining bottom navigation modules and never computes a next step of VR.
